title: Performance Improvement Course for Solving Social Issues Using Subgoal Labeling

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic social problem-solving procedures and tools
context.additional_context: Learners perform corporate social problem-solving tasks in microlearning environments using mobile devices. Formative assessments provide immediate feedback and facilitate learning improvement

learning_goals: Learners can explain social problem-solving procedures with 80% accuracy by applying subgoal labeling strategies.
Learners can solve complex social problems with over 70% accuracy using labeled examples.
Learners can apply formulated problem-solving procedures to real-world corporate cases and propose solutions with a 60%+ success rate.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
